author: Special Correspondent
text:
The district administration launched the first-level checking of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) and Control Units here on Wednesday under the supervision of officials from Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL).

Collector S. Natarajan, accompanied by Revenue Divisional Officer R. Rampratheeban launched the checking of the EVMs and control units kept at the godown at the regulated market complex here.

The checking with representative of a recognised political party would go on till February 24, the Collector said. The district administration received 2,500 EVMs and 1,674 control units for the polling in ensuing four Assembly constituencies in the district.

A total of 364 polling stations had been established in Mudukulathur Assembly constituency followed by 321 each in Thiruvadanai and Ramanathapuram constituencies and 301 in Paramakudi (Reserve) constituency, he said.

After the first-level checking and clearance of existing data if any in the machines, the EVMs would be linked to the control units and a mock polling would be conducted before they were despatched to the polling stations.
title: First-level checking of EVMs gets under way
